.
Exposure to Environmental and Military Occupational Hazards
Veterans may have been exposed to a variety of environmental and occupational hazards during their military service.  Exposure events can be claimed either based on service in a specific location, as discussed in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iii, 9.A.1.b
, or based on occupational duties and responsibilities.
Important
:  When the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) does not recognize presumption of exposure or a presumption of service connection (SC) for specific disabilities due to claimed environmental and occupational hazards, the claim must be processed under direct SC provisions, or other theory(ies) of SC raised by the Veteran or evidence of record.
References

, and
